types.name: color
types.description: Allows user to select a color and returns the hex value for that color. The color picker used is native to the OS or the browser.

types.name: date
types.description: Allows user to enter a date (year, month, and day) without a time.

types.name: datetime-local
types.description: Allows user to enter a date (year, month, and day) and a time, with no time zone.

types.name: email
types.description: Allows user to enter an email address. Some mobile devices will deliver custom keyboards specifically for entering email addresses.

types.name: file
types.description: Allows user to select a file. To define the type of files that can be selected, use the accept="" attribute.

types.name: month
types.description: Allows user to enter a month and year with no time zone.

types.name: number
types.description: Limits user to entering only numbers. Some mobile devices will deliver a custom keyboard.

types.name: password
types.description: Single-line text input whose value is obsecured. Use the minlength and maxlength attributes to specify the value length.

types.name: range
types.description: Allows user to enter a number who exact value isn't important.

types.name: search
types.description: Single-line text input for entering search strings. Some mobile devices will deliver a custom keyboard.

types.name: tel
types.description: Allows user to enter a telephone number. Some mobile devices will deliver a custom keyboard.

types.name: time
types.description: Allows user to enter a time value with no time zone.

types.name: url
types.description: Allows user to enter a website URL. Some mobile devices will deliver a custom keyboard.

types.name: week
types.description: Allows user to enter a date consisting of a week-year number and a week number with no time zone.

attributes.name: accept
attributes.description: If the type is file, then this attribute will indicate the file types that will be accepted. The value must be a comma-separated list.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description: Indicates if the control value can be automatically completed by the browser. For a full list of possible values, please visit MDN Inputs page.

attributes.name: autofocus
attributes.description: Lets you specify which form control should have input focus on page load. Only one element can have this attribute and it cannot be set on hidden elements.

attributes.name: capture
attributes.description: If the type is file, then this Boolean attribute will indicate that the capture of media directly from the device's environment using a media capture mechanicism is preferred (e.g. taking a photo using a camera).

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Boolean attribute that indicates the input is not available for interaction.

attributes.name: form
attributes.description: This attribute associates the form element with the input element. The input value must be the form's id value within the same document. If this isn't specified, the input will use the closest ancestor form element. This attribute allows you to place inputs anywhere on the page, not just as a descendant within a form element. An input can only be associated with one form.

attributes.name: max
attributes.description: Maximum numeric or date-time value for this item, which cannot be lesser than the minimum value.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: If type is text, email, search, password, tel, or url; this attribute sets the maximum number of characters that can be entered.

attributes.name: min
attributes.description: Minimum numeric or date-time value for this item, which cannot be greater than the minimum value.

attributes.name: minlength
attributes.description: If type is text, email, search, password, tel, or url; this attribute sets the minimum number of characters that must be entered.

attributes.name: multiple
attributes.description: If type is email or file, this attribute allows for more than one value.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the control which is submitted with the form data.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: Provides a hint to the user of what can be entered into the control.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: Indicates that the control cannot be modified by the user. This is ignored if the type attribute is hidden, range, color, checkbox, radio, or a button type.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Specifies that the user must provide a value for this control before submitting the form. This is ignored if the type attribute is hidden, image, or a button type.

attributes.name: selectionDirection
attributes.description: Specifies the direction in which a selection occurs.

attributes.name: selectionEnd
attributes.description: The offset into the element's text content of the last selected character. If there's no selection, this value indicates the offset to the character following the current text input cursor position (that is, the position the next character typed would occupy).

attributes.name: selectionStart
attributes.description: The offset into the element's text content of the first selected character. If there's no selection, this value indicates the offset to the character following the current text input cursor position (that is, the position the next character typed would occupy).

attributes.name: size
attributes.description: The control's initial size.

attributes.name: spellcheck
attributes.description: Setting the value to true indicates that the element needs to have its spelling and grammar checked.

attributes.name: step
attributes.description: Works with min and max attributes to limit the increments at which a numeric or date-time value can be set.

attributes.name: tabindex
attributes.description: Position of the element in the tab navigation order for the current document.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Initial value for the control.
